description:
Elvita Apartments is located in the safe area of Ampelokipi, near Athens Tower, 3.5km from the center of Athens - Syntagma Square and the Acropolis. It is 250m from the Hippocratic Hospital, 300m from the People's Hospital, 600m from the Children's Hospital , 850m from the Athens Euroclinic, 850m from Alexandra Hospital and 1km from Henry Dunant Hospital. The nearest metro station - Ampelokipi is 800m away.
It offers fully equipped energy, new apartments with free Wi-Fi, air conditioning-heating and a flat screen TV.
Each unit consists of a bedroom, a living room, a bathroom with shower, and a kitchen.
The kitchen is fully equipped with kitchenware, oven-hob, microwave, coffee maker, toaster, kettle . There is also a washing machine - clothes dryer, iron-ironing board, hairdryer,
There is parking available upon availability (at an additional charge).
Eleftherios Venizelos Airport is the nearest and is 30 km away from the property.

neighborhood_overview:
Athens is the capital of Greece and one of the oldest cities in the world. With a rich history and culture emerging from every corner, Athens offers a one-of-a-kind experience to its guests.

Close to your residence in Athens, you will find several attractions that are worth visiting. These include:

- The Stoa of Attalos: This ancient arcade is located in the Agora area of Athens and is one of the city's top archaeological sites.

- Little Kook: A magical world full of imagination and color awaits you at Little Kook. This themed cafe is adorned with striking decorations and offers a one-of-a-kind experience for kids and adults.

- City Museum of Athens â Vourou-Eftaxi Foundation: This museum hosts an extensive collection of artifacts highlighting the history of Athens. From ancient artifacts to modern art, this museum will take you on a journey through time.

- Museum of Greek Folk Musical Instruments "Phivos Anogianakis" - Center of E

name: Relax in this funky loft next to metro!
description: This May 2019 renovated studio-loft, right in the city center, is close to family-friendly activities, major Greek hospitals, nightlife, public transportation (1 minute to âMegaro Mousikisâ metro), next to. Kolonaki neighborhood, as well as 20 minutes from the Acropolis. Youâll love it because of the light, the funky sofa, the comfy bed, the kitchen, and the coziness. The loft is ideal for couples, solo adventurers, and business travelers.
neighborhood_overview:
The âMegaro Mousikisâ area is a centrally located neighborhood, popular for its residential and business appeal. During day time you can meet a variety of people, from locals and businessmen to medical school students who run to catch their morning classes, since the Athens med school and many hospitals are around the corner. :)

Its upbeat character will keep you hooked since there is never enough time to enjoy all the cozy cafeterias in the area!

Nearby the building a plethora of busses pass by and it is only 1 minutes, by foot, away from the âMegaro Mousikisâ metro stop and minutes away from the American Embassy and âMaviliâ square! Next to Mavili there is âMegaron Mousikisâ where a variety of cultural events and concerts takes place!

Psiri and Monastiraki neighborhoods The Byzantin Museum, Acropolis, the Acropolis museum, Plaka, Monastiraki flea market, as well as Lycabettus hill and all the upbeat Athens neighborhoods are easily reachable by foot.
host_about:
Kalimera (=Good Morning)! I am Alexandros, an ex-financier who turned into an entrepreneur.

I grew up in Athens, Greece, an awesome and vibrant city, where I studied Civil Engineering at NTUA. I was always keen on music, a passion which I flipped into DJing, yeap!!! Following my graduation I wanted to see the world and study abroad, so I attended Columbia University in NYC for my second Masters degree. The 2008 crash sent me directly to Germany where I started my career in banking.

After some years in corporate environments I decided to follow my real love, which is creating things from scratch, so I quit my job and alongside with my brother, George, we began a hospitality start-up.

We provide unique furnished apartments by offering personalized services!

It is so awesome to be an explorer and we believe that if you do not travel is like reading only the cover of the book. Hence,  t-r-a-v-e-l  :)

We hope to enjoy your staying with us!!!!

Keep it real,
Alexandros.

Psyri is a colorful neoclassical neighborhood known for itsÂ artisans,Â specialty stores, Â  restaurants, bars, tavernas with or without live music,Â theaters, art galleries, antique shops, and a small number of hotels.
The central square of Psyri is called "Heroes Square" because the streets leading to it carry names of heroes of the Independence War.
A distinguished resident of Psyri was the most important Greek novelist Alexandros PapadiamantisÂ who settled in the area for more than two decades.Â In the early 1990s,Â following a series of renovation and construction works, the Psyri neighborhood became a popular nightlife and residential area andÂ it has now become a fair choice in the center of Athens.Â In Psyri you may visit the church ofÂ Agioi Anargyroi.

neighborhood_overview: Amerikis Square (Greek: Î Î»Î±ÏÎµÎ¯Î± ÎÎ¼ÎµÏÎ¹ÎºÎ®Ï, Plateia Amerikis, "America Square") is located in central Athens. It is an open area adjacently to Patision Street, on the western borders of Kypseli. Formerly called Agamon Square, literally "square of the unmarried", the neighbourhood around the square includes, along with central Kypseli, many modernist apartment buildings built during the 1930s. The area offers everything you need: weekly markets and supermarkets as well as other small shops for daily needs in the immediate vicinity, 3 metro stations and only a short walk to the new trendy districts of Kypseli, Metaxourgiou, Keramikos and Psirri with its bars and restaurants .

The Athens area of Monastiraki is a central area. You're not likely to find hordes of tourists here, even though it's only about a 5 minute walk from Syntagma Square. It's within the boundaries of Ardettos Hill, the First Cemetery of Athens and the Temple of Olympian Zeus.

The First Cemetery of Athens, the oldest in the city
Panathenaic Stadium, also known as Kallimarmaro, where the first modern Olympic Games were held
Kolonaki, upscale, well-known neighborhood
Temple of Hephaestus, Athens
Temple of Olympian Zeus, Athens
Parthenon, Athens
Agios Georgios Church, Lycabettus Hill

Kerameikos Cemetery

Odeon of Herodes Atticus
The National Gallery
Syntagma Square

neighborhood_overview: Known for its urban ambiance yet a homey neighborhood feel, Pagrati was always a favorite among the art and political circles, also attracting visiting students due to its central location next to all of Athens's vibrant life. Nevertheless, the curious its the unpretentious feel and its homey charm abundant in all the cafÃ©s and places around. The sunlight during the morning hours hits the walls of Pagrati and creates that buzzing feels, adding so much to it. Greek delis, art shops, and indie galleries share streets with pizzerias, casual tavernas, and gourmet restaurants. A bit further uphill and at the back of the stadium lies a hidden lush paradise around Varnava square, once mostly known to connoisseurs for Greece's best restaurant Spondi by Apostolos Trastellis. This area attracts burger lovers to Colibri, curious foodies to Baba Ghanoush Falafel Shop, and the cool kids to Chelsea Hotel curbside drinks. Whatever you do, Pagrati offers so much to explore!

neighborhood_overview:
Ampelokipoi/Panormou is a hip neighborhood, consisting of both residential and commercial properties. Thus, every morning, you can meet a plethora of different personalities, from college students and residents, to traders and young professionals.

Ampelokipoi, an old established neighborhood, in the first half of 1900âs used to have in its premises small vineyards, but this utterly changed with the industrialization of Greece. Now, it has been transformed to a vibrant area full of stylish bars, traditional cafes and restaurants.

Acropolis, the Acropolis museum, Plaka, Monastiraki flea market, as well as Syntagma square and all the upbeat Athens neighborhoods are in the immediate vicinity.

Upon arrival, we provide you with tailor-made recommendations. Enjoy âAthens by nightâ while being minutes from home ;)

host_about:
Our philosophy is "whenever you travel abroad, live like a local, not a visitor!"

We always enjoyed traveling around the world and learning about other cultures.

First came our fascination to meet people around the globe, exchange stories and see our city in different ways through their eyes. This fueled a desire to create âaeiphoriaâ suites into the historical centre of Athens and yet far enough from the hustle and bustleat. 
The studios are exactly as described and in a superb location, in the  heart of the city.

We strongly believe that we can relate to very different types of people and help them experience Greek hospitality, giving priority to high standards of accomodation and attending to the needs and expectations of guests!

We consider each one of you our guests and not customers. 
We will be very happy to give you recommendations during your stay, in order to feel "local". And of course to support you when you are exploring Athens. 

Aiming to continiously improve the holiday experience of our guests....let us be your host!

host_about:
Dear Guest, 

A very warm welcome to Athens Boutique Residence.

We appreciate that you have chosen to stay at our premises. We will do everything to ensure that your overall experience is more comfortable. Your personal satisfaction in our facilities is our main priority.

The spaces apart from the comfortable apartments, offers a nice and comfortable rooftop terrace. A place where you can enjoy the view of the city of Athens and the green park of Strefi.

Furthermore, in order to make your stay even better, we have prepared a welcome book, that you will find in your apartment, which includes useful information for the building and the city, interesting places that you may visit and are on a walking distance from our area, as well as other matters that could make your visit in Athens more comfortable. . 

Should you require any additional help or information during your stay with us, please do not hesitate to contact our Lobby Manager, at the lobby of our premises or the support telephone line of Athens Boutique Residence.  For emergency matters you may contact the building supervisor, who is located at the ground floor next to the main entrance.  

May I take this opportunity to thank you for having chosen the Athens Boutique Residence and we look forward to serving you again in the near future.

Sincerely,


Your Athens Boutique Residence Team

Spirou Trikoupi Street is located in the vibrant neighborhood of Exarcheia in Athens, Greece. This area is known for its lively atmosphere, cultural scene, and historical landmarks. One of the highlights of the neighborhood is the National Archaeological Museum of Athens, located less than a mile away from the apartment. This museum is one of the most important archaeological museums in the world, with an impressive collection of artifacts from ancient Greece and other Mediterranean civilizations.

In addition to the museum, Exarcheia is also home to a variety of cafes, bars, and restaurants that cater to all tastes and budgets. Whether you're in the mood for traditional Greek cuisine or international dishes, you'll find plenty of options to choose from. Some of the most popular restaurants in the area include Yiantes, a traditional taverna that serves homemade Greek dishes, and Estrella, a cozy spot known for its vegan and vegetarian fare.

neighborhood_overview:
The Area:

Gazi-Keramikos is a historic neighborhood located northwest of the Acropolis in central Athens. The area is named after two of its most prominent landmarks: the Gazi Technopolis cultural center and the Keramikos archaeological site, which contains ancient burial grounds and other archaeological remains.

The Gazi-Keramikos area is known for its vibrant nightlife, with many bars, clubs, and restaurants catering to both locals and tourists. The neighborhood is also home to several museums and art galleries, including the Benaki Museum Pireos Annex, which features contemporary Greek and international art.

In terms of public transportation, the Gazi-Keramikos area is served by several bus routes, as well as the Athens metro system. The Keramikos metro station is located in the heart of the neighborhood, providing easy access to other parts of Athens.

The nearest airport to the Gazi-Keramikos area is the Eleftherios Venizelos Internationa

neighborhood_overview:
Welcome to Athens! Athens is the capital of Greece and one of the most historic cities in the world. This city combines ancient and modern culture and offers a wealth of attractions for you to discover.

The Municipal Art Gallery of Athens is one of the leading cultural venues of the city. There you will find an impressive collection of works of art by artists from Greece and abroad. It is an ideal opportunity to discover the local art scene.

Avdi Square is a lively space in the center of Athens. Here you will find many cafes, restaurants and bars, where you can enjoy local food and drinks. The square also has a market, where you can buy local products and souvenirs.

From your accommodation, you will be within walking distance of these attractions and have easy access to other popular city attractions such as the Acropolis, the Acropolis Museum and the Plaka.

neighborhood_overview: Just a short walk from the city center, Pangrati is gentle by day, spirited by night, and full of character all the time. Perched above the imposing Panathenaic Stadium, better known as the Kallimarmaro, Pangrati is a cozy yet quirky neighborhood with steep streets that give impressive glimpses of Lycabettus Hill and Mt Parnitha in one direction and dramatic views of Mt Ymittos in the other. Far removed in character but not in distance from the tourist areas of Plaka and Psyrri, Pangrati holds a certain charm that leaves you feeling as if youâve stumbled across a secret. Its backstreets are an intriguing mix of neoclassical and modern architecture, and they often lead to quaint squares full of life. Like many other parts of Athens, Pangrati is a mix of the new and the old, but in the charming Oliver, a recently opened artisanal shop displaying an impressive array of nuts, dried fruits, wines, and chocolate bars, you get a sense of the quality in store in this unpretentious and welcomin

neighborhood_overview:
The area:

Welcome to Athens, the vibrant capital city of Greece located in the region of Attica. Athens is a city steeped in rich history and culture, offering a myriad of attractions and experiences to visitors from around the world. Known as the birthplace of democracy and the cradle of Western civilization, this ancient city is a treasure trove of archaeological wonders, magnificent landmarks, and a lively contemporary scene.

One of the highlights of Athens is its extensive public transportation system, which allows visitors to explore the city and its surrounding areas with ease. The Athens Metro is the fastest and most convenient mode of transportation, consisting of three lines that connect to tram lines, bus routes, and the suburban railway. The metro operates from 5 am to midnight, with extended hours on weekends, ensuring easy access to key areas and attractions. Line 1, also known as ISAP, is an overground train that connects the northern suburb of Kifis

The area:

The ancient Greek world surrounds this apartment in the city's central northeast. It is situated in a residential area convenient to many prominent landmarks or points of interest. Athens Music Hall, Nicholas P. Goulandris Foundation - Museum of Cycladic Art, Lycabettus Hill, and the Benaki Museum are nearby. Syntagma Square, Athens' central square, is two short stops away on the Metro.



The charming and upscale district of Kolonaki is about a 15-minute walk - a must-see area. You'll find numerous cafes, restaurants, and upscale boutiques. Don't miss Kolonaki Square while there!



Don't miss the trendy, cultural neighborhoods of Gazi and Psyrri with their excellent local tavernas, pubs, and open-air cafÃ©s.



The port of Piraeus, a charming and ancient port city known for its seafood restaurants and ferries to the Greek islands, is about 7-8 km.

neighborhood_overview: Our limehome is located in one of the liveliest areas of Athens. Solonos Street offers a range of charming boutiques, cosy cafÃ©s and cultural highlights. From here you can easily explore the city's treasures on foot. During the day, many visitors flock to the Athens market halls, where typical Greek specialities are literally stacked up. In addition to Lycabettus Hill, which you can reach on foot in just a few minutes, our communal rooftop terrace offers a special retreat in the heart of the city. name: Metaxourgio 2 Bedroom Gem for Urban Explorers
description: This well-appointed apartment is brand new, bright, and cheerful! Located in the Metaxourgio district of Athens, it sits just at the northern edge of Central Athens. It's a short walk to the nearby Metro station, where public transportation can whisk you across town or out to the area's best beaches. If you prefer, you can take a leisurely walk to most of Athens' cultural sites. Each of the city's districts has something of interest along the way.
neighborhood_overview:
The area:

Discover Athens from the Metaxourgio district of Athens in the city's center. The Acropolis Museum and Syntagma Square are just a 10-minute Metro ride away. The National Theater of Greece is a few blocks away. The international airport is about 22 miles away.
Ancient culture, rich history, and tradition make Athens like no other city in the world. It's a city vibrant with character and charm. We suggest taking morning strolls and exploring the shopping districts and central squares of Syntagma, Omonia, and Monastiraki. And, of course, no visit to Athens would be complete without seeing our historic sites, such as the Acropolis and Parthenon! The city comes alive at local taverns, bars, and high-end restaurants at night. There is something for everyone in Athens.

Things to do in Athens:
The National Archaeological Museum
Streffi Hill for magnificent views of the city and the Acropolis.
Saint Nicholas Pefkakia Church
Laiki Farmer's

neighborhood_overview:
Ilisia, a historic Athens neighborhood named after the ancient river Ilissos, is an inviting central hub that radiates an ever-growing vibrancy. It's where Socrates once imparted wisdom, and the Muses of lore are said to have resided. Today, the area boasts charming coffee shops like Lot51, celebrated for its excellent coffee and surf vibe, and artisanal bakeries such as Tromero Paidi. For art enthusiasts, the National Gallery's extensive collection is a cultural treasure troveââ.

Culinary delights abound in Ilisia, from the no-frills authenticity of Papagiannis Taverna to the delightful small plates at O Platanos Ouzeri. For a sweet treat, Epik Gelato offers Greek-inspired flavors, and evenings are well-spent enjoying craft beers or the finest Negroni at Cyrano En Ville. The Athens Concert Hall adds a dash of artistic flair to the neighborhood, featuring a range of musical performances and in summertime, a beautiful garden setting. The local food scene is epitomized by Tsif

neighborhood_overview:
Athens, the capital of Greece, is a city with a rich history and culture. It is known for its ancient attractions, which include the Ancient Agora of Athens, one of the most important archaeological sites in the country.

In close proximity to your accommodation, you will find the following attractions:

1. Heraklion Museum (2nd building): A museum that houses a collection of works of art and archaeological finds, with an emphasis on ancient Greek art and philosophy.

2. Ancient Agora of Athens: An archaeological site that includes ancient buildings and palace complexes. Here you can discover the city's rich history and admire ancient architectural masterpieces.

3. Heraklion Museum: A museum dealing with science, art and technology. Here you can see exhibits related to physics, mathematics and art history.

4. Church of Agia Marina: A beautiful church built in the 11th century. It is known for its architectural beauty and the spiritual

neighborhood_overview:
The apartment is located in the Koukaki area, next to the historical district of Plaka (on the foothills of the Acropolis) and borders Filopappou and Thisio neighborhoods from the west.
The two largest streets that cross Koukaki are Veikou Street (north-to-south) and Dimitrakopoulou Street (south-to-north). On the borderline between Koukaki and Neos Kosmos stands Andrea Syngrou Avenue, an important avenue in Athens that connects the center with Poseidonos Avenue to the south.
Koukaki is one of the most charming neighborhoods in Athens, with its unevenly paved sidewalks lined with bitter orange trees, has an undeniably urban village feel. One of Koukaki' s highlights is the blend of architectural styles it contains. Surrounded by neoclassical houses and low rise buildings dating from the 1930s, including small shops, traditional restaurants, art galleries, museums and colorful bars and cafes.

neighborhood_overview:
The area of Gyzi is a typical Athenian residential area. It is located in the center of Athens while at the same time maintaining the elements of the neighborhood and this is the main contrast that characterizes it. It is one of the areas that when you walk through its streets you look up. Not so much because apartment buildings have some special beauty, but because there is "life" there. Behind the colored awnings, in the conversations that can be heard from the open windows, in the spread clothes that add extra color to the balconies. It has several squares and gathering places that gives it vitality.

It is close to the Athens University of Economics and Business and is bordered by Pedion Areos, which is the largest public park in Athens with the Alsos theatre within. The Pedion tou Areos, meaning Field of Ares, was designed in 1934 and its purpose was to honor the heroes of the Greek Revolution of 1821, 21 of whom are depicted in marble busts standing in the park. neighborhood_overview:
This is a wonderful part of downtown Athens that offers proximity to some of the most important landmarks in the world, as well as great options for dining or meeting with business partners and friends. Everything you need, from supermarkets, bakeries and grocery stores to bustling cafes and bars, modern eateries, fancy restaurants and chic shopping, is within fast and easy walking distance. Plus, bus and metro connections are excellent, if you want to venture beyond the city centre â every corner of which is accessible by foot when you feel like taking a leisurely stroll.

Highlights

Kolonaki Square â the beating heart of Athensâ most prestigious neighbourhood â is a mere 5-minute walk away and so are the areaâs high-end boutiques and stores, art galleries, museums, bustling bars and chic restaurants. Acropolis, Plaka and the historical centre are less than 30 mins on foot while Syntagma Square is 1,2 km.

We are thrilled to welcome you to one of our Airbnb apartments in Athens, our goal is to ensure that you have a five-star experience in staying with us. 

We are part of a local fun and exciting hospitality group called MyGreekVacations managing more than 100+ beautifully designed custom-made apartments inspired by our travels and our stays in airbnbs around the world. The experience of meeting so many lovely people along the way is something we particularly enjoy, and the city of Athens is a hub where you can always find things to experience, see and do and we canât get enough of it.

Our priority is to create a comfortable, relaxing and âhome away from homeâ experience for our guests, a âworkationâ atmosphere for those who wish to combine business with leisure and to always be readily available and provide as much info and assistance as possible; all the things we value when traveling somewhere new ourselves.

Our home is your home! We treat our guests like lifelong friends and we love to spoil them during their visits.

We hope to see you soon.

host_about:
A very warm welcome from me, Theoharis, the owner of Vilaman ÎÎÎ, the property management company that is running this property.
Having traveled extensively in the Americas, SE Asia and Europe, and being a demanding traveller myself, I adapted my experiences to my native Greece and combined them with our philoxenia: the ancient greek word that literally means a âfriend to a strangerâ and is synonymous to hospitality. 
For Greeks however, it is something deeper than that., it is an unspoken cultural law that shows generosity and courtesy to strangers. 
In addition, my personal relationship with each property owner allows me to make sure that everything runs smoothly, as desired, so that our every guest feels at home at our properties and takes a unique experience and unforgettable memories back home with them.

name: 1 bdr cozy apt N. Arch. Museum
description:
This is a cozy 1 bedroom apartment in the heart of Athens, face of the National Archaeological Museum (in 80m), located between 2 Metro stops (Omonia & Victoria).
The location is in the middle of everything offering easy access to the larger city either by the Metro or by the numerous bus lines stops in front of the Polytechic University (in 120m). The central coach station on Mavromateon str. in 250m offers access to the beaches of Attica peninsula.
I'll be happy to host you.
Nikos
host_about:
Hi, I'm Nikos, living and working in Athens for almost all my life, except of a period when I was working for a multinational firm and been living and working in many European countries.

I am married to Kiriaki and we have 2 sons.

I own and manage many apartments in the very inner center circle of Athens (some of them beside the Metro, in 30-50m) and a few others in the larger Athens. 
All of them are either brand new or recently fully renovated. 
Depending on the apartment, they dispose free private Parking, extraordinary views of the city, Smart TVs, Satellite TV connection (1200 free channels), etc. They all beautifully decorated and dispose fully equipped (for long stays) kitchens, 42-50" LED TVs, Home Cinema, DVD collection, WiFi internet, A/C in all rooms, outdoor space (terrace, balcony, patio).
 
What I love mostly in my work is to meet different people & cultures from all over the world and to share our experience of life. 
What a wonderful feeling is when my guests thank me after having spent some unforgettable time in one of my apartments in this great city - Athens.
I wouldn't exchange this for the world.

I'll be very happy to host you in one of my apartments and provide you with all necessary information and tips on what you "must see", where and how to go, where to eat (and where not...!!) and so make your life easy and save a lot of your vacation time.

I can organize your transports inside/out of Athens (with VIP vehicles), starting from your pick-up from/to the airport, then a tour around the sites of Athens or a short daily escape to the larger Attica or your trip to Delphi, Mycenae, Epidaurus, Ancient Olympia, etc. 

Don't hesitate to contact me for further information (...no charge...!!).

neighborhood_overview:
The Area:

Located in the heart of Athens, the Makrigianni neighborhood is a prime destination for visitors seeking to immerse themselves in the rich history and vibrant culture of Greece's capital. This area is renowned for its close proximity to some of Athens' most iconic landmarks, making it an ideal base for both tourists and business travelers. Just a short stroll away lies the Acropolis, the ancient citadel that houses the Parthenon, Erechtheion, and the Temple of Athena Nike. The nearby Acropolis Museum, a modern architectural marvel, offers an extensive collection of artifacts and provides deep insights into the ancient world.

Makrigianni is also known for its charming streets lined with neoclassical buildings, quaint cafes, and traditional Greek tavernas. The vibrant Plaka district, with its labyrinthine alleys, shops, and restaurants, is just a few minutes' walk away, offering a delightful blend of the old and new. This historical neighborhood is perfect

name: Cosy 2 Bd apt near Metaxourgio Area
description: This well-appointed apartment is brand new, bright, and cheerful! Located in the Vathi district of Athens, it sits just at the northern edge of Central Athens. It's a short walk to the nearby Metro station, where public transportation can whisk you across town or out to the area's best beaches. If you prefer, you can take a leisurely walk to most of Athens' cultural sites. Each of the city's districts has something of interest along the way.
neighborhood_overview:
The area:
Discover Athens from the Vathi district of Athens in the city's center. The Acropolis Museum and Syntagma Square are just a 10-minute Metro ride away. The National Theater of Greece is a few blocks away. The international airport is about 22 miles away.
Ancient culture, rich history, and tradition make Athens like no other city in the world. It's a city vibrant with character and charm. We suggest taking morning strolls and exploring the shopping districts and central squares of Syntagma, Omonia, and Monastiraki. And, of course, no visit to Athens would be complete without seeing our historic sites, such as the Acropolis and Parthenon! The city comes alive at local taverns, bars, and high-end restaurants at night. There is something for everyone in Athens.

Things to do in Athens:
The National Archaeological Museum
Streffi Hill for magnificent views of the city and the Acropolis.
Saint Nicholas Pefkakia Church
Laiki Farmer's Market

âº Athens' Landmarks:
â¢ Square of Metaksourgeio (5min / 400m).
â¢ Square of Kerameikos. This full of life square, provides you with a variety of options, from street food to night clubs and cafeterias (20min / 1,5km).
â¢ Technopolis: an industrial museum and a major cultural venue, on square of Kerameikos.
â¢ Omonoia square in the center of Athens (5min / 350m).
â¢ Acropolis of Athens by car (4,9km)
â¢ Acropolis Museum (âAcropolisâ metro station, Red line, M2)
â¢ National Archaeological Museum, which ranks among the leading museums in the world and hosts rare art treasures from the Neolithic era up to the Roman period (400m)
â¢ The renowned Benaki Museum, with its outstanding collections (2.2km) by car
â¢ Syntagma square & Parliament (âSyntagmaâ metro station, Red line, M2) (12 min.)

name: The Industrial Chic
description: This cozy, open-plan space blends industrial and contemporary elements. The bedroom features a wooden platform bed with crisp white linens, set against a concrete wall illuminated by ambient lighting. A sectional sofa with neutral cushions faces a minimalist black metal and glass coffee table. Large windows with sheer curtains let in natural light, creating an airy, inviting atmosphere. The design perfectly balances industrial materials with chic, modern touches.
